ygData.subject: Re: Getting our Concerns Noticed
ygData.msgSnippet: the fact of the matter is, sk are bad asses... Hard to play? ermm, better step back and try a necro or something.... My wife ogre started level one fri night
ygData.messageBody:
the fact of the matter is, sk are bad asses...
Hard to play? ermm, better step back and try a necro or something....
My wife ogre started level one fri night at 6 pm, she was level 7 at 11 am
the next morning, killing froglocks non stop, she made level 10 last
night....
ermm, everything i read says sk come into there own at higher levels...
looks like to me they pretty damn tough at lower levels, and as for leveling
slowly...heh, not!
Naraka from cazik thule
----- Original Message -----
From: Leif Smart <leifsmart@...>
To: <shadowknight@onelist.com>
Sent: Wednesday, April 28, 1999 10:26 PM
Subject: [shadowknight] Re: Getting our Concerns Noticed


> From: Leif Smart <leifsmart@...>
>
> I must say that a massive Feedback campaign is not the way to go. I would
try
> to email Verant with a well written letter, and cross post it to the
message
> boards as well as the major web pages. If all this doesn't work, it would
be
> understandable if you went to greater length to be heard.
>
>
> However, I don't think there are any issues to be raised. I fully
comprehended
> when it told me my character would be Hard to play, and that is half the
> challenge of it. Sure it is a pain in the arse, but until you start to
enjoy
> your character for what it is and what it can do, you will never enjoy EQ.
It
> is pointless compareing yourself to other characters and wishing you had
what
> they had. To be perfectely honest, I beleive I have no equal in combat at
my
> level other then another SK, and i am only lvl 14. I have had this belief
> since I was level 8 and beat the crap out of a lvl 9 monk. I still beleive
I
> can do the same against every other class.
>
> Inos
>
>
>
> erik lawrence antonsen wrote:
>
> > From: erik lawrence antonsen <eantonse@...>
> >
> > Well, it sounds like people are interested in trying something. We need
> > to:
> >
> > 1. Come up with a couple common things that we want addressed.
> >
> > 2. Have 1 day where everyone gets on and /feedbacks them either the
> > same statement or a statement containing identical issues.
> >
> > So how many people are on this list? How many are willing to
participate?
> > And when do we want to do it?
> >
> > Oogog
> >

> > Always remember to pillage BEFORE you burn.
